body:
Oh, very nice find!

We urgently need an ASAN Travis job :-)

By applying
```diff
diff --git a/src/wallet/wallet.cpp b/src/wallet/wallet.cpp
index e41f829f02..602c0df088 100644
--- a/src/wallet/wallet.cpp
+++ b/src/wallet/wallet.cpp
@@ -548,7 +548,9 @@ bool CWallet::HasWalletSpend(const uint256& txid) const

 void CWallet::Flush(bool shutdown)
 {
+    WalletLogPrintf("CWallet::Flush Start\n");
     database->Flush(shutdown);
+    WalletLogPrintf("CWallet::Flush Finish\n");
 }

 void CWallet::SyncMetaData(std::pair<TxSpends::iterator, TxSpends::iterator> range)

```
```
2018-09-10T10:39:47.214696Z [w8] CWallet::Flush Start
2018-09-10T10:39:47.214768Z BerkeleyEnvironment::Flush: Flush(false)
2018-09-10T10:39:47.214831Z BerkeleyEnvironment::Flush: Flushing w8 (refcount = 0)...
2018-09-10T10:39:47.214964Z BerkeleyEnvironment::Flush: w8 checkpoint
2018-09-10T10:39:47.218020Z BerkeleyEnvironment::Flush: w8 detach
2018-09-10T10:39:47.220806Z BerkeleyEnvironment::Flush: w8 closed
2018-09-10T10:39:47.220943Z BerkeleyEnvironment::Flush: Flushing wallet.dat (refcount = 0)...
2018-09-10T10:39:47.222169Z BerkeleyEnvironment::Flush: wallet.dat checkpoint
2018-09-10T10:39:47.226511Z BerkeleyEnvironment::Flush: wallet.dat detach
2018-09-10T10:39:47.228803Z BerkeleyEnvironment::Flush: wallet.dat closed
2018-09-10T10:39:47.228939Z BerkeleyEnvironment::Flush: Flush(false) took              14ms
2018-09-10T10:39:47.229057Z [w8] CWallet::Flush Finish
2018-09-10T10:39:47.229146Z [default wallet] CWallet::Flush Start
2018-09-10T10:39:47.229217Z BerkeleyEnvironment::Flush: Flush(false)
2018-09-10T10:39:47.229398Z BerkeleyEnvironment::Flush: Flush(false) took               0ms
2018-09-10T10:39:47.229482Z [default wallet] CWallet::Flush Finish

```
w8 and [default wallet] files are in the same directory. That flush order is weird.

They might use the same database?

Steps to reproduce (with valgrind):

```
./src/bitcoind -regtest -datadir=/tmp -printtoconsole
mv /tmp/regtest/wallets/wallet.dat /tmp/regtest/wallets/wallet_moved_no_dat
valgrind ./src/bitcoind -regtest -datadir=/tmp -printtoconsole -wallet="" -wallet=wallet_moved_no_dat

2018-09-11T21:16:07Z [default wallet] CWallet::Flush Finish
2018-09-11T21:16:07Z [wallet_moved_no_dat] CWallet::Flush Start
2018-09-11T21:16:07Z [wallet_moved_no_dat] CWallet::Flush Finish
2018-09-11T21:16:07Z scheduler thread interrupt
2018-09-11T21:16:07Z Dumped mempool: 0.002633s to copy, 0.003621s to dump
2018-09-11T21:16:07Z [default wallet] CWallet::Flush Start
2018-09-11T21:16:07Z [default wallet] CWallet::Flush Finish
2018-09-11T21:16:07Z [wallet_moved_no_dat] CWallet::Flush Start

2018-09-11T21:16:07Z [wallet_moved_no_dat] CWallet::Flush Finish
2018-09-11T21:16:07Z [default wallet] Releasing wallet
2018-09-11T21:16:07Z [default wallet] CWallet::Flush Start
2018-09-11T21:16:07Z [default wallet] CWallet::Flush Finish
2018-09-11T21:16:07Z [wallet_moved_no_dat] Releasing wallet
2018-09-11T21:16:07Z [wallet_moved_no_dat] CWallet::Flush Start
2018-09-11T21:16:07Z [wallet_moved_no_dat] CWallet::Flush Finish
2018-09-11T21:16:08Z Shutdown: done
Note that it only happens when moving the `wallet.dat` to a file without the `.dat` extension.
Not sure in this context, but wallet name needs to either be folder containing a "wallet.dat" file or an arbitrary filename of an existing file in the root wallet dir (for backwards compatibility).

In this case `./wallets/wallet_moved_no_dat` is "an arbitrary filename of an existing file in the root wallet dir" as well as `./wallets/wallet_moved.dat` (with the extension). But the bug is only seen when the ".dat" is missing.
I think I was wrong that this only happens when the `.dat` extension is missing. At least now I can reproduce regardless of that.
Maybe the original filename is embedded somewhere in the wallet file and some pointers are freed based on that name as opposed to the current file name?

> I think I was wrong that this only happens when the .dat extension is missing. At least now I can reproduce regardless of that.

If the filename is ends with `.dat`, it can be reproduced by call `bitcoin-cli loadwallet w8.dat` twice. The first time would fail, and the second time would succeed.
#14320 was merged, but the issue still exists on master

An ASAN suppression for this issue is now in `master`:

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/6541d59ddc2b1b475187e6cbe76a50ee6e85b421/.travis.yml#L111
